subject: Economics
title: Chicken: The Game of Brinkmanship
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Chicken: The Game of Brinkmanship.

hook.text: Two cars race toward each other. The first to swerve is the 'chicken.' Neither swerving means both die.

buildup.text: In the game of Chicken, the worst outcome is mutual destruction. Each player wants the other to back down first.

discovery.text: The Cuban Missile Crisis was a real-life game of Chicken.

twist.text: The winning strategy: convince your opponent you WON'T swerve. Throw your steering wheel out the window.

climax.text: Chicken teaches that in brinksmanship, the most dangerous player is the one who credibly commits to self-destruction.

punchline.text: In Chicken, the rational strategy is to convince everyone you're crazy.

quiz.question: What is the paradoxical winning strategy in the game of Chicken?
options: Credibly commit to not swerving ‚Äî making irrationality the rational choice
